did.unittitle: Bryn Mawr College Assistant to the President (Isabel Maddison) letterbooks

bioghist.p: Isabel Maddison (1869-1950) received a Ph.D. from Bryn Mawr College in 1896, under the direction of Charlotte Scott, the first female head of the Department of Mathematics. From 1895 to 1904 she served as secretary to President M. Carey Thomas and as a Reader in Mathematics. In 1905 she became Assistant to the President and Associate in Mathematics at Bryn Mawr. In 1910 she was appointed Recording Dean of the college. She retired in 1926.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of letterbooks kept primarily by Isabel Maddison and Caroline Lewis, assistants to President M. Carey Thomas. The collections also includes letterbooks of the Editorial Committee of the Graduate Club, 1896-1903; Library correspondence, 1901-1902; Assorted Committees, 1915-1919; and the Low Building Association, 1907-1918.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
